revised_title: Investigations into Segmental Representation of Movements in the Lumbar Region of the Mammalian Spinal Cord
tldr: The authors investigate the segmental representation of movements in the lumbar region of the mammalian spinal cord through direct excitation of the anterior and posterior roots. They find that movements are primarily represented in the postero-external column of the spinal cord and that there is a lateral arrangement of points for producing different movements. Additionally, they observe a functional distinction between anterior and posterior roots, with anterior roots causing extension and posterior roots causing flexion.
